Based on the preferences given, I would recommend "Real Women Have Curves" which stars Lupe Ontiveros and Nia Vardalos.

This movie follows two sisters who come from a small community in Mexico. The sisters move to Los Angeles, where they work at a local radio station. 

The main conflict in the movie revolves around the characters' aspirations and desires. For instance, one of the sisters dreams about becoming a successful businesswoman, while the other sister dreams about becoming a famous singer.

Despite their differences, both sisters learn valuable lessons throughout the course of the movie. 

Ultimately, "Real Women Have Curves" is an entertaining and heartwarming movie that tells a beautiful story about friendship, love, and aspirations.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Crucible". This historical drama is based on a true story about the witchcraft trials in Salem, Massachusetts during 1692.

The movie stars Kevin Bacon, William Hurt, and Jennifer Connelly. The plot revolves around John Proctor (Kevin Bacon), who is accused of practicing witchcraft. Proctor must defend himself against the accusations made by his accuser Elizabeth Proctor (Jennifer Connelly)).

"The Crucible" has received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike. It has been nominated for numerous awards, including Academy Awards for Best Picture and Best Actor (William Hurt)), Golden Globes for Best Motion Picture - Drama (The Crucible)), and Screen Actors Guild Awards for Outstanding Cast in amotion picture, television series, or web series (The Crucible)).
